What book is The movie The Bravados based on?

The movieThe Bravados is based on the bookThe Bravadoswritten by  Frank O'Rourke

The Bravados 12/1/1988

When three desperados escaped from the new jail in Rio Arriba they grabbed Emma Steinmetz, a fine horse - and a lot of guns. Jim Douglas had been doing time too - framed for debt by Emma's greedy father. Now he's leading the high country hunt for the convicts. But a strong-willed woman has joined the posse, with her own ideas about right and wrong. And Douglas has something left to learn...

The 9th Golden Age of Weird Fiction MEGAPACK®: Frank Belknap Long

written byFrank Belknap

Published by Wildside Press LLC - 9/21/2016

Prepare yourself for more macabre spectacles and contes cruel, crawling things and loathsome gods, predators from deep inside the mind of man and from far outside angled space, all brought to you by the incomparable Frank Belknap Long! Included are 20 short stories and the complete text of Long's 1977 poetry collection. Here are: JOHNNY ON THE SPOT THE MAN FROM NOWHERE FISHERMAN'S LUCK THE REFUGEES GRAB BAGS ARE DANGEROUS STEP INTO MY GARDEN IT WILL COME TO YOU RETURN OF THE UNDEAD THE PEEPER THE HOUSE OF RISING WINDS HUMPTY DUMPTY HAD A GREAT FALL FUZZY HEAD LITTLE MEN OF SPACE NIGHT-FEAR MR. CAXTON DRAWS A MARTIAN BIRD PREVIEW COTTAGE TENANT PROBLEM CHILD GATEWAY TO FOREVER THE NECRONOMICON, JOHN DEE'S TRANSLATION IN MAYAN SPLENDOR (Poetry) If you enjoy this ebook, don't forget to search your favorite ebook store for "Wildside Press Megapack" to see more of the 300+ volumes in this series, covering adventure, historical fiction, mysteries, westerns, ghost stories, science fiction -- and much, much more!

The Life of John O'Hara

written byFrank MacShaneandProfessor Frank MacShane

Published by Dutton Adult - 1/1/1980

Based on his correspondence, autobiographical writings and interviews with friends and acquaintances in England and the United States, this biography of O'Hara shows how his life and prolific writing were interactive elements in a creative and often courageous response to loneliness.

Did you know that the movie The Bravados is based on the book The Bravados?

Jim Douglass (Gregory Peck) has been relentlessly pursuing the four outlaws who murdered his wife, but finds them in jail about to be hanged. While he waits to witness their execution, they escape; and the townspeople enlist Douglas' aid to recapture them.

  • Internet Movie Database:  7.0/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes:  100%
